docs.snippet: The effor to lift a political and economic blockade imposed on Cuba a decade ago by the Organization of American States verged on collapse today. Latin-American foreign ministers advocating a rapporachement were two votes short of the two-thirds...
docs.lead_paragraph: The effor to lift a political and economic blockade imposed on Cuba a decade ago by the Organization of American States verged on collapse today. Latin-American foreign ministers advocating a rapporachement were two votes short of the two-thirds majority necessary to life the sanctions agains the government of Fremier Fidel Castro.

headline.main: PRO-CUBANS SHORT OF VOTES IN O.A.S.; Move to Lift Blockade Still Lacks Needed Two-thirds--U.S. Plans to Abstain

docs.snippet: The effort to lift a political and economic blockade imposed on Cuba a decade ago by the Organization of American States Verged on collapse to day. Latin-American foreign ministers advocating a rapprochement were two votes short of the two --thirds...
docs.lead_paragraph: The effort to lift a political and economic blockade imposed on Cuba a decade ago by the Organization of American States Verged on collapse to day. Latin-American foreign ministers advocating a rapprochement were two votes short of the two --thirds majority necessary the government of Premier Fidel Castro.
docs.abstract: efforts to lift pol and econ blockade on Cuba by OAS verges on collapse Nov 11 at Quito, Ecuador, meeting with advocates being 2 votes short of necessary 2/3 majority; US, Brazil, Nicaragua, Haiti and Guatemala have reptd that they will abstain in vote; Brazil, Chile and Uruguay mins suggest that session be suspended because resolution acceptable to 2/3s of members cannot be found; illus of Victor Gomez Berges, Foreign Min of Dominican Repub, addressing OAS, US Deputy Sec Robert S Ingersoll and Honduras Min Ricardo Pineda Milla (M)

headline.main: PRO-CUBANS SHORT OF VOTES IN O.A.S.; Move to Lift Blockade Still Lacks Needed Two-thirds--U.S. Plans to Abstain

docs.snippet: Uruguayan peso is devalued 7.95% on Nov 13; devaluation is 11th since Pres Juan Maria Bordaberry began series of 'mini-devaluations' on Mar 1 '72 (S)
docs.abstract: Uruguayan peso is devalued 7.95% on Nov 13; devaluation is 11th since Pres Juan Maria Bordaberry began series of 'mini-devaluations' on Mar 1 '72 (S)

docs.snippet: Kid-napping. The word carries within itself the memory of its coining. Lindbergh, the Mob, the Depression: men in homburgs sit at strangely-shaped microphones--Walter Winchell. Crime as a continuous headline.
docs.lead_paragraph: Kid-napping. The word carries within itself the memory of its coining. Lindbergh, the Mob, the Depression: men in homburgs sit at strangely-shaped microphones--Walter Winchell. Crime as a continuous headline.
docs.abstract: Sir Geoffrey Jackson book Surviving the Long Night. An Autobiographical Account of a Political Kidnapping revd by J Durden Smith

docs.snippet: A United Nations report has provided a picture of the pitiable conditions under which millions of migrant, workers live and work in Africa, Latin America and Western Europe.
docs.lead_paragraph: A United Nations report has provided a picture of the pitiable conditions under which millions of migrant, workers live and work in Africa, Latin America and Western Europe.
docs.abstract: Recent UN staff rept reveals migrant workers in Africa, Latin Amer and Western Europe face pitiable conditions; findings supported by Intergovernmental Com for European Migration dir John F Thomas; Thomas says job situation is becoming even more precarious because of rising unemployment and other econ difficulties; rept is critical of conditions in S Africa; notes many foreign workers in S Africa come from Malawi, Mozambique and Lesotho; shows concern for plight of Bolivians working, often illegally, in Argentina; notes distinguishing feature of migration in Latin Amer is high incidence of illegal movement; conditions in France, W Ger, GB, Switzerland, Belgium, Sweden and Netherlands outlined; steps taken to remedy poor housing and educ situations outlined (M)

headline.main: U.N. STUDY SHOWS MIGRANTS' PLIGHT; Migrant Agency Concurs Illegal Migration Noted Housing Problems Felt Laborers in Europe, Africa and Latin America Found Facing Slum Conditions

byline.original: By KATHLEEN TELTSCHSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: The military Government of Chile has been charged with "extremely serious violations of hunch rights," including extensive torture of political prisoners, in a report by a five-nation investigating team of the Organization of American States.
docs.lead_paragraph: The military Government of Chile has been charged with "extremely serious violations of hunch rights," including extensive torture of political prisoners, in a report by a five-nation investigating team of the Organization of American States.
docs.abstract: OAS 5-nation investigating team composed of Uruguay, Argentina, US, Brazil and Chile charges Chilean mil Govt with extremely serious violations of human rights, including extensive torture of pol prisoners, 175-page document prepared by Inter-Amer Comm on Human Rights on basis of 12-day tour of Chile by team last summer; group visited 12 installations and cited in rept examples of alleged violations; lengthy Chilean Govt rebuttal, submitted with rept, contends rept contains important and grave deficiencies and manifest errors; does not contest charges of individual torture cases; Chilean Amb Manuel Trucco says Chilean authorities are preparing more detailed response to charges and expresses hope that documents taken together would help end any possible violations of human rights in Chile; team also notes that Chile, since receiving its recommendations last summer, has dismissed some members of its police, indicted others for participation in acts of torture and released some pol prisoners (M)

headline.main: Chile Accused of Torture By O.A.S. Investigators; Ex-Ambassador Is Member New Investigation Asked

byline.original: By DAVID BINDERSpecial to The York Times

docs.snippet: The General Assembly's Legal Committee recommended today that proposals for United Nations action against international terrorism be put off for consideration for another year.
docs.lead_paragraph: The General Assembly's Legal Committee recommended today that proposals for United Nations action against international terrorism be put off for consideration for another year.

headline.main: DEBATE ON TERROR DELAYED AT U.N.; West Germany, Israel and U.S. Deplore Move to Put Off Issue for a Year Delegates Criticize Decision

docs.abstract: Summary article on outcome of Greek referendum establishing republic over monarchy and return of exiled King Constantine; notes full restoration of democratic Govt has begun in wake of 2-to-1 vote against monarchy and Greek Parliament's actions on drafting new Const (S)
